attributes.action: Affordable homes: amend law on new builds, compulsory purchases & shared schemes
attributes.background: Current law allows developers to build unaffordable homes (£175-£200k more for an area) on communal lands and on homes taken by compulsory purchases. Displaced residents are given less money than needed to relocate locally. Developers are still able to own sold homes via shared ownership schemes.
attributes.additional_details:
Change the rules of compulsory purchases to ensure displaced residents get replacement values (not market value) plus 10%
 
Require homes built on communal land or compulsory purchased homes to be no more than 110% of the market value for older homes.
 
Ban shared ownership schemes if the price is more than 110% of the market value of older properties. New build homes are escalating housing inflation with their pricing which is underpinned by shared ownership schemes.

attributes.action: Outlaw the sale of new build properties as buy-to-let "investments"
attributes.background:
Too many new-build properties are sold as buy-to-let "investments", often at first refusal before they are even complete.  This restricts supply, keeps prices inflated, and usually keeps young people off the property ladder and in the trap of high private rents.

This should be outlawed.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK is facing an unprecedented housing crisis in terms of supply, cost, and the extremely high private rents.  Young people are trapped for YEARS as tenants, or living with parents, because there are precious few affordable homes in many places.

There are whole new-build housing estates and blocks of flats which are sold off in advance (often before the property is even built) and become 100% BTL empires from the very first day, not available for people to actually buy for themselves.

attributes.action: Mandatory for ALL eye tests to include Pupillary Distance (PD).
attributes.background: Without the Pupillary Distance (PD) it is impossible to create prescription glasses, get the distance wrong and depending on how inaccurate it is, can cause the following symptoms: blurry vision, double vision images, headaches, nausea, and fatigue.
attributes.additional_details:
- 69% of the UK population wear prescription glasses
- Online retailers can be 40% cheaper than high street opticians
- It is unfair that people on lower incomes are forced to buy cheap     glasses when they could afford fashionable frames and lens if they could buy from online retailers.
- Opticians don't provide PD today pointing to Statutory Instrument (1984 No. 1778). This was last reviewed in ’84 the internet was just for email then!! So this badly needs an update.

attributes.action: Require manufacturers of milk alternatives to use non-plastic bottles.
attributes.background: I care deeply about the environment and I hate seeing the continual use of non-recyclable plastic cartons for my dairy-free alternatives to milk. I do not see why they cannot be manufactured into  environmentally friendly containers. I wish this environmental issue to be discussed in parliament.

attributes.action: Increase the age that a puppy can be imported into the UK to six months.
attributes.background:
By doing so the risk to the individuals dog's health and behaviour, the risk to healthy dogs within this country will reduced hugely.  
This will tackle the illegal puppy trade as dogs will be more mature when imported and are less likely to be sold on to unknowing members of the public.
attributes.additional_details:
Importing a puppy can cause great harm to the dog through the impacts it will have on its behaviour and health. This also put other dogs at risk as the puppy can be carrying diseases such as rabies and lung worm which are not found natively in the UK. 
By raising the legal age of importing it reduces these risks along with tackling the illegal puppy trade. At six months old dogs are more mature and are less likely to be sold on to unknowing members of the public.

attributes.action: Abolish 3 points for vehicles with defective tyres CU30, change to a fine only!
attributes.background: Drivers get 3 points for defective tyres as it stands, I find this far too severe a punishment when combined with a fine as it leads to insurance being dearer. A fine is ample enough.
attributes.additional_details: Dvla offence code CU30

attributes.action: Give children a choice of water or squash with school dinners
attributes.background: Not all children like water, I myself as an adult don't like it either. So why should a child as young as 4 be made to go all day without a drink because it's the only drink offered with school meals. My daughter being a 4 year old i think it's unfair.

attributes.action: Demand a formal independence referendum for Catalonia
attributes.background: The behaviour of the Spanish national police and Guardia Civil in relation to the Catalonian independence referendum is shocking and has no place in a Western democracy. The British government should stand with the Catalan people and demand a free and fair referendum on their independence from Spain
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/world/2017/oct/01/dozens-injured-as-riot-police-storm-catalan-ref-polling-stations

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-41461032

The Spanish authorities have undertaken what amounts to a violent crackdown on people attempting to exercise their democratic right to self-determination. Even the court findings that the vote is illegal do not justify violence by police against peaceful citizens.

attributes.action: Mandatory for all hospital theatres to evacuate diathermy  tissue smoke plume.
attributes.background: Despite having risk assessments,some surgeons are reluctant to use smoke evacuation, which puts perioperative staff and patients at a risk of breathing in harmful diathermy tissue smoke.
attributes.additional_details:
Diathermy smoke called plaque, is also carcinogenic and mutagenic and even contains hydrogen cyanide.One gram of diathermy tissue is equal to smoking six (6) unfiltered cigarettes.

I want the government to make diathermy smoke evacuation a compulsory requirement rather than a recommendation.

http://ortoday.com/the-real-risks-surgical-smoke/

attributes.action:
Stop Shisha Smoking in the UK
It increases your risk of cancer, heart disease
attributes.background:
Stop Shisha Smoking in the UK
Smoking Shisha can be 100 times more harmful than smoking cigarettes. It increases your risk of cancer, heart disease and respiratory disease.
attributes.additional_details: A World Health Organization study has suggested that during one session on a hookah (around 20 to 80 minutes) a person can inhale the same amount of smoke as a cigarette smoker consuming 100 or more cigarettes. Hookah smoke also contains nicotine, cancer-causing chemicals and toxic gases such as carbon monoxide.Despite the wholesome-sounding flavours, shisha tobacco is just as dangerous and is linked to the same life-threatening diseases, such as heart disease and cancer.

attributes.action: Review the current VED (Road tax) system and implement a pay per mile system.
attributes.background: The current road tax system uses a blanket rule type system to cover the taxation of all uk vehicles based solely on emissions. This system does not take into account how much time each of these vehicles is spent on the road causing wear and tear on the road network.
attributes.additional_details:
A review and overhaul of the tax system is required to bring a  fairer balance to road users. 

E.g - a pensioner who makes one trip a week in his car.  Should not pay the same amount in road tax as someone who uses their car for commuting to work everyday.

The current system does not reflect road use/wear and tear on the network. This could be easily be rectified by directly linking the VED (Road tax) to the fuel at the pump. 

The more fuel you use in your car the more tax you pay.

attributes.action: To make the new British passports post Brexit Rainbow colour
attributes.background: One of the major issues for Brexiters is the blue passport of a bygone age. It does not represent the modern multicultural Britain of today. It further fuels the divide. Those supporting the inclusive, vibrant nation that we are today should support a rainbow coloured passport that reflects this.

attributes.action: Stop anyone paid from the public purse being paid more than the prime minister
attributes.background: We pay the prime minister around £150k to run the country so it is both illogical and unfair to pay a council CE £160k or more for running a small budget operation with zero competition. We do not need to compete in the open market for those good enough to perform in non competitive sectors
attributes.additional_details: The public sector is not in competition with anyone. Your local council will not be beaten by a competitor so why do we need to pay premium salaries for managerial staff. The BBC is funded by a tax in the form of licence fee so why do we need to at newsreaders £400k plus to read the news. They are not attracting advertising and it is perfectly possible to keep promoting younger journalists if they leave. The same is true for all publicly funded or supported jobs.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for Nurseries to charge on Bank Holidays or when closed.
attributes.background: I am a full time working parent, I have been since my daughter was 9 months old. I have paid in the region of £1300-950 a month for my child to attend full time nursery. Nurseries still have the right to charge full fees when closed or Bank holidays. Which means double fees or unpaid/annual leave.
attributes.additional_details: I understand it is so difficult for mums to take that leap back to work when childcare costs so much money!!! Unless you're unemployed or less hours you don't seem to be entitled to anything. Nurseries then have the right to charge for days the nursery is closed. Including Bank Holidays, training days & other. Some of us working parents that don't have family then have to pay out double fees or have to take annual or unpaid leave for this facility. It's another penalty that should not be allowed.

attributes.action: Allow  frontline ambulance staff to carry CS gas / or pepper spray
attributes.background: With the increase on assaults in the nhs and both ambulance services . It would be benificial to make it optional for ambulance workers on the frontline to carry some form or procetion/self defence equipment.

attributes.action: Companies must be required to specify what animal gelatine is in their products
attributes.background: In my case, I have found that it is a common theme to find that "gelatine" is an ingredient to many confectionery items. This itself presents a grave concern, as I am a follower of the Islamic faith, who does not eat pork. Thus, failure to specify the type of gelatine is misleading.
attributes.additional_details: The rationale of ingredients being displayed on the back of food packaging is that we are in a position to exercise our autonomy. So, we can make an informed decision of whether or not it is something we wish to consume. This detail should be a basic requirement for all product packaging and be given the attention similar to allergy warnings. This applies to many sectors of society Muslims, Judaism, Hinduism, Sikhism and sects of Christianity. Therefore, essential in such a diverse society.

attributes.action: Eliminate financial requirement for UK citizens bringing legal spouses to the UK
attributes.background: Currently EU citizens can settle their non-EU spouses in the UK on proof of a legal marriage. For UK citizens there are additional income or capital requirements. These additional requirements discriminate against UK citizens and can prevent resettlement of their non-EU spouses.
attributes.additional_details:
Government rules for British citizens to bring non-EU spouses to the UK are forcing some to have to leave the UK or abandon their spouse. The Government should be looking after these citizens above all others. British citizens shouldn't have to face this government imposed dilemma of choosing between their spouse and their country.
 
This petition proposes the elimination of the income and capital hurdles that discriminate against UK citizens settling their legal spouses in the UK.

attributes.action: Establish a support body to advise and protect Beneficiaries of Wills and Trusts
attributes.background: Support body to provide free help and advice to beneficiaries:  To ensure proper estate administration.  Advising on; confusing Will language, dwindling estate concerns, uncertainty of legal rights, high executor fee charges, lack of transparency or information, unresponsive administrators etc.
attributes.additional_details:
This support body (funded by increase in Probate tax) to:-

•Provide legal advice to beneficiaries in clear and simple terms   
•Ensure executor accountability 
•Have powers to take action against executors to protect beneficiaries where there are failings in responsibilities and duty of care.

We ask for Parliament to change the law, ensuring that executors are legally bound to clearly inform beneficiaries of the existence of this body and provide its contact details with Will delivery.

attributes.action: Abolish driver cpc, it's not improving driver standards, it's causing a shortage
attributes.background: The Driver cpc was brought in to educate and raise standards of professional drivers, this has had no affect, as a driver I see the standards are the same. Drivers learn their skill set in accordance to their jobs. Forcing drivers to pay thousands in useless training, causing a huge driver shortage

attributes.action:
Mandatory signs on all disabled facilities -
"Not all disabilities are visible"
attributes.background: Since developing a chronic urinary disease, I have found myself needing to use disabled facilities often. However, due to not bearing any obvious or visible disability and only a hidden one, I have faced criticism and been confronted on many occasions as to why I am using such facilities.
attributes.additional_details:
Myself and thousands of other people who suffer from unseen disabilities are having to defend ourselves and on many occasions show proof as to why they need to use disabled facilities. 
When I am in need to use the disabled loos, I have often been confronted by others. This is discrimination.

I am petitioning for all disabled facilities in the UK to bear mandatory signs reading "Not all disabilities are visible". 
This is to aim to put a stop to such discrimination and prejudice.

attributes.action: Introduce 'reading dogs' to all primary schools in England
attributes.background: Research shows that children can get very stressed with reading aloud in class. Reading to dogs is a good way of stopping children feeling scared - dogs do not make comments or tell you off for getting things wrong and they always listen. All primary schools should have access to a 'reading dog.'
attributes.additional_details:
The Kennel Club already run a 'Bark and Read' scheme https://www.thekennelclub.org.uk/barkandread 
Lane, H.B. & Zavada, S.D.W. 'When reading gets ruff: canine-assisted reading' The Reading Teacher 2013, 67(2) p. 87-95

attributes.action: Garages must provide free air & water in working order for drivers at all times.
attributes.background: Road safety requires that drivers maintain vehicles by law, yet garages charge for & / or fail to provide working air and water at petrol stations. This petition seeks a legal requirement, that all petrol stations must provide free air & water services at all times as a condition of trading.
attributes.additional_details:
There were 8459 petrol stations in the UK in 2016 (Source: Statista) The experience of many drivers nationally is that air & water services are often lacking, of poor quality, not working & / or expensive. 
Oil companies & government make profit & tax revenue from motorists. This petition seeks to ensure that drivers may be assured of the free provision of air & water services, maintained in good working order at all times, this being a condition of trading for all garages throughout the UK.

attributes.action: More funding towards cure research for Type 1 Diabetes
attributes.background: In June 2017 at the age of 18, I was diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes. Beforehand I was perfectly healthy. I did nothing to cause this to come on, nor does anyone else suffering from this unfair disease.
attributes.additional_details: I'm requesting far more funding to go towards finding a cure for Type 1 Diabetes so that people who suffer from this unfair disease can have some hope.

attributes.action: Parliament to not debate holding an second brexit referendum
attributes.background: In 2016 the UK voted to leave the EU by 17 million votes. Parliament to debate holding another vote would be against an Democratic vote.

attributes.action: Stop cyclists from using mobile phones and headphones whilst in motion.
attributes.background: As a cyclist myself, it irritates me when I see other bike riders giving the rest of us a bad reputation by using mobile phones or listening to music on headphones whilst in motion. And don't get me started on ignoring traffic lights! The rules of the road need to be enforced.

attributes.action: Ban video games that promote violence and sexual abuse.
attributes.background: I would like the UK Government to change the laws on video games which normalise gun violence, prostitution, rape etc. There are children as young as 7 playing these games online without their parents knowing. This is not something that should be acceptable, full stop.
attributes.additional_details: Why should these games showing guns, sex, prostitution, gangs and so on be available to children when violence, acid attacks, rape and murders are happening in our country?

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for alcoholic drinks to list all ingredients.
attributes.background:
I have a severe life threatening allergy to the artificial colourant E110 (Sunset Yellow) and nuts.

Alcoholic drinks in the UK do NOT have to list their ingredients anywhere, not on the product nor online. 

This is so unsafe for people who have allergies and could lead to preventable deaths

attributes.action: Stop Kim Jong Un from ever coming to the UK.
attributes.background: Kim Jong Un is becoming increasingly powerful and reckless, we can't allow a man like that in our country.

attributes.action: Stop the practice of charging self funding OAPs higher care rates than councils
attributes.background: Self funding residential care or nursing pensioners subsidise the fees for  council patients by hundreds of pounds per week for exactly the same care. All fees should be transparent and equal for all clients. Councils must pay more, private funders should pay the equivalent rate to ensure fairness.
attributes.additional_details:
Financial Times Article:
https://www.ft.com/content/6c61fa30-f1dc-11e6-8758-6876151821a6

AGE UK report:
https://www.ageuk.org.uk/Documents/EN-GB/Press%20releases/behind_the_headlines_care_homes_oct2016.pdf?dtrk=true

Express Article:
https://www.express.co.uk/comment/expresscomment/723552/Wrong-sensible-savers-to-subsidise-care-elderly-old-age-saving-self-funding

attributes.action: Put a Tax on all excessive packaging Including plastic and cardboard.
attributes.background: Most packaging that is being used in supermarkets is only a quarter to half full of the product. This is to make you think that you’re buying more than you’re getting. (Cardboard box) We have received a item no bigger than 5 x 4 Inches, but the box it came in was roughly 18 x12 x14 Inches.
attributes.additional_details: All companies to use no more than 10% of the packaging that is required for packing of the product.

attributes.action: Stop reducing child maintenance monies by allowing travel expenses to be claimed
attributes.background: Did you know that when child maintenance monies are awarded through the CMO (previously CSA) they allow the non resident parent to claim travel expenses (regardless of how far they wish to move away) against the child maintenance award thus lowering it further. Stop disadvantaging our children.
attributes.additional_details: Child maintenance is normally sought via the CMO as a last resort when other avenues have been explored for fairness for the child. The key focus for resident and non resident parent should be THE CHILD and providing financial and emotional stability as if you hadn’t separated.  This claiming process looks to add conflict. Child maintenance was set up to aid THE CHILD. The non-resident could chose to move away 100’s of miles away yet the child would be monetarily disadvantaged as a result.

attributes.action: Exempt Commonwealth soldiers and veterans from paying fees for naturalization
attributes.background: Foreign commonwealth soldiers and veterans should be exempt from paying fees during naturalisation, life in the U.K. test, and language test as long as they have served for the minimum contract required and have qualified for the length of stay required.
attributes.additional_details: After serving in the British Army from commonwealth countries, you’re still required to undertake life in the U.K. test, language test and also pay the fee required for naturalisation. This is very sad after you have put your life on the line to serve in the queens army to defend the British well being.

attributes.action: Scrap Part P, someone with 5 days experience is not safe to work on electrics
attributes.background: The public are being mislead on the terminology of what makes an electrician, often employing a Part P company over and approved electrician as they believe Part P is the same as Gas Safe.
attributes.additional_details:
Electrician training
3 or 4 Years ( and must have served as apprentice)
Exams;
level 2 - 6 units consisting of practical and theory exams 
level 3  - 7 units consisting of practical and theory exams
NVQ 3 - At least 1 year served and assessed by competent electrician with evidence of all areas of electrical work
AM2 - 16.5 hour exam on practical skills and theory
Regulations - online exam 

Part P Domestic Electrical Installer training
5 Days
Exams;
40min multiple choice Exam

attributes.action: Promote drug harm reduction information and services
attributes.background: There were 3744 drug related deaths in the UK in 2016. The government currently provides no official harm reduction information or services. 35% of the UK's population have taken drugs in their lifetime. The government needs to promote harm reduction information and provide testing services.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is to promote harm reduction in the UK in the following ways: 
- Allow licenced premises to test drugs 
- Make drugs reagent kits readily available 
- Make pharmacies have reagents where drugs can be tested for free anonymously 
- Promote information on how to use drugs safely
- Promote information on what to do in an emergency situation for a friend or family member
These services will cut drug deaths and save the NHS money. Statistics about deaths and usage are from drugwise.org

attributes.action: Science is compulsory at GCSE. Make it an option.
attributes.background: Help young secondary students realise their potential and stop the stigma around academic subjects being "more necessary. "
attributes.additional_details: As a society we have advanced enough for there to be jobs in a variety of different industries. There are opportunities to go down career paths besides a scientific one. Creativity and individuality should be something we teach the youth of today, it's dissapointing that the education system has rules set in place that make students feel they aren't clever enough just because they are not as academically gifted as others. Science is compulsory, but wouldn't it seem wrong if Drama or Art was made compulsory at GCSE? Students are not shunned for "lack of creativity" so why should it be the other way around? Please sign this petition so the government may consider debating this.

attributes.action: Charge all Foreign Vehicles entering the UK
attributes.background: All Foreign Vehicles entering the UK to use our roads and motorways, to be charged a one year payment, and be issued a Vignette to register for their use of our road system.
attributes.additional_details:
If most of Europe can charge for their roads, it should be done in the UK, to help our economy, by extra revenue for maintaining our road infrastructure.
As an Island Nation we have the ideal opportunity, to charge at all Ports of entry.

attributes.action: Scrap VAT on Digital Books
attributes.background: Currently, Print books are exempt from VAT, whereas eBooks are subject to tax.
attributes.additional_details:
Since the Government launched an action plan to inspire thousands more pupils to read in 2015, and that digital books are now the preferred medium for many, it makes no sense to tax youngsters whilst trying to increase readership.

If the Government are serious about tackling reading standards, scrapping the VAT on eBooks is surely one way to make a positive impact.

https://www.gov.uk/government/news/new-action-plan-to-inspire-thousands-more-pupils-to-read

attributes.action: Make the questions on PIP forms more suitable for mental health sufferers.
attributes.background:
Recently many people have had their Personal independence payment stopped and are no longer meeting the criteria. 
 From experience i think the questions are more aimed at people with physical disabilities and mental retardations rather than mental health issues.
attributes.additional_details:
Questions such as how far can you walk?
Can you prepare food?
Can you wash yourself?
To make the forms more suitable for people suffering with severe mental health issues they need to be asking questions such as...
1. How is your sleep effected?
2. How do you feel when you go outside?
3. Do you have times when you neglect your hygiene?
4. Have you ever had addiction problems?
5. How are you at handling your finances?
6. How is your memory?
7. How often do you experience a symptom? Ect ect...

attributes.action: Require shop signs to be turned off overnight to reduce light pollution
attributes.background: The UK Government and Parliament should change the law to require illuminated business signs to be switched off at night to reduce light pollution in towns & cities.
attributes.additional_details: LB Merton has, at great expense, replaced street lights to help reduce the amount of light pollution in the area. Their efforts are wasted because of a huge Sainsbury’s sign nearby which remains lit throughout the night. The M&S sign, on the same building, is on a timer and turned off between 11-6.

attributes.action: Ensure that no claimant on benefits is left without financial support.
attributes.background: I am hearing about families losing their homes and needing to use food banks due to a sudden removal from one set of benefits to the new one:- universal credit. It can't be right - the benefits should run seamlessly into each other. This is totally inhumane.
attributes.additional_details: This has happened to someon I know with a disabled child.

attributes.action: Repeal the Psychoactive Substances Act 2016
attributes.background:
This act made the sale, distribution, and consumption of all psychoactive substances (with the exceptions of food, tobacco, alcohol, caffeine and poppers) illegal.
This a ridiculous piece of legislation that in no way serves public health or even law and order, and is in effect a ban on fun.
attributes.additional_details:
This legislation puts people at risk by sending these substances into the hands of criminal gangs. It also criminalises harmless drug users, putting them into contact with more dangerous offenders in prison, and increasing the already dangerously high prison population.
An evidence-based drugs policy will allow for properly safe, regulated use, and allow people who might have problems with these drugs to feel safe getting help. This law is a waste of police resources and an affront to freedom.

attributes.action: Make hoax callers to emergency services pay £200 fine or a prison sentence
attributes.background: Over the past year, Wiltshire emergency services had over 1,000 hoax calls, and because they have a duty of care, they have to go to every call, so whilst there attending the hoax calls, there's hundreds of people that need an ambulance
attributes.additional_details: I believe, making sure every hoax call is investigated properly, there there should be a £200 fine or a prison sentence,  and if it's a child doing it, then the parents should pay it, or the child do some kind of community service,

attributes.action: Discuss regulating veterinary practices and the excessive fees they charge.
attributes.background:
Veterinary fees are excessive and affect the consumer in many ways. The fees also push up the pet insurance fees where many pet owners cannot afford these. 
The vets know the owners don't have the money and then charge excessively knowing the owner will pay the fees to protect their beloved pet.
attributes.additional_details:
Vets Now recently charged £140 for emergency consultation, to update the database £17 and admit the pet to hospital £200.80 then administer the medication, blood test and scan which eventually totalled £702.04. A further £700 was issued and then consulation and putting the pet to sleep costing £240. 
The total cost was £1640.84 with VAT and didn't result in saving the life of the pet as the Vet wanted more money costing over £3000. 
Ridiculous prices which need agreeing and regulating.

attributes.action: To make a new Act of Parliament, namely, The Protection from Online Bullying Act
attributes.background:
Online Bullying has become very wide spread on social media and educational forums causing emotional and psychological suffering, and in some cases even suicide.  
It is not enough to report online bullying, the Search Engines need to be compelled to have sanctions in place to deter the bullies.
attributes.additional_details:
Because there is not an specific Act in place to compel online bullies to behave in a reasonable way, their behaviour causes damage to people's lives, and, there needs to be a law with sanctions to prevent this from happening.
Without a  law to deter cyber-bullying with sanctions, it will snowball out of control, as the evidence in the media indicates.

attributes.action: A petition to action Government to posthumously pardon all Suffragettes
attributes.background: From 1900 to the beginning of WW1 approximately 1,000 women were imprisoned in the British campaign to gain the votes for women.These women suffered and sacrificed a lifetime for generations today to live an equal life.These women should be posthumously pardoned and celebrated for their bravery.
attributes.additional_details: As a relative of Emmeline Pankhurst there has never been a more appropriate time to pursue the notion of having suffragettes that were imprisoned during the Votes for Women campaign posthumously pardoned and their efforts celebrated. Despite the peaceful efforts of Millicent Fawcett, Emmeline and her daughters at the start of the campaign, progress was slow and their voices dampened. Many courageous women pushed the campaign forward in a way that ensured their voices were heard 'Votes for Women'

attributes.action: Moped riders must have a full license. Not a provisional one.
attributes.background: Recently the number of mopeds thefts on main streets has increased drastically. This is primarily caused by teenagers on mopeds snatching phones while riding. This is enhanced by the fact that to get a moped you only need to have a provisional license which is exceedingly easy to obtain.
attributes.additional_details: The number of thefts in London has skyrocketed in recent years. Within the twelve months leading up to June 2017 the metropolitan police recorded 16,158 thefts on mopeds alone. The majority of these thefts is by teenagers with learner plates; who require no experience or background checks before being able to ride. We propose that all people wishing to obtain a moped require a full license.

attributes.action: Allow adoption for adults over the age of 18 like in the usa
attributes.background: Adult adoption has been legal in most states of the USA since 2002. I myself am 27 and have never known my biological father and I am at an age where I would like my step father to be allowed to do so if he wishes.

attributes.action: Make it legal for motorcyclists to ride without a helmet on
attributes.background: In the UK it has been illegal for most to ride with a helmet on. This does not apply to certain religious groups. I think that bikers from all walks of life should get the choice if they use a helmet or not.
attributes.additional_details: When Motor Cycles (Wearing of Helmets) Regulations 1973 (S.I., 1973, No. 180) was passed, it became illegal in the UK for anyone to ride without a helmet on. This was amended by the Crash-Helmets (Religious Exemption) Act, 1976, to give some groups the ability to opt out of using them. I don't debate that they have saved lives, but a study done in the US stated that it was only a 37% decrease. Furthermore it is primarily the biker that will face the consequences, so why force them into using one.

attributes.action: Ban smacking of children in England
attributes.background: Scotland and Wales are considering banning corporal punishment of children by their parents. Scientific evidence shows that smacking children is damaging. This form of discipline should no longer be legally allowed in England.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.news.com.au/lifestyle/parenting/new-study-reveals-long-term-impacts-of-smacking-children/news-story/1d9cd66ef864f33feb38de4dd3e4da41

https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/what-science-says-and-doesn-t-about-spanking/

attributes.action: Offer tests for women on the NHS after ONE miscarriage
attributes.background: I have suffered 5 miscarriages in total, one being this year in 2017. I knew after the first two that something wasn’t right and pushed and pushed for testing. Unfortunately the NHS guidelines currently say that women need to have had 3 consecutive miscarriages before being offered tests.
attributes.additional_details: Now after 5 miscarriages I have been tested and found to have (aps) often known as sticky blood which means I would need a blood thinning injection daily if I was to become pregnant again. This could have saved my 5 babies’ lives but because of this guidance, that unfortunately wasn’t the case. I am hoping to get this changed so other women like myself can get the answers and save the heartbreak please help.
